items.t: A farmer can use a tablet to check the weather.
Teachers can use computers to make quizzes.
Computers can do jobs without instructions.

fields.title: Mission 1: Instructions & steps,  Mistakes & fixing them  Patterns

questions.q: What is an instruction?

options.text: A step that tells you what to do

questions.q: Why do steps matter?

a2_next_step.question: You opened your laptop. What should you do next?

steps.text: 🍞 Put the second bread on top

a1_order_steps.prompt: Put the steps in the correct order to make a sandwich 🥪

a3_fix_mistake.prompt: Fix the instructions (one step is wrong!)
a3_fix_mistake.explain: You should read the lesson before closing the notebook.
a3_fix_mistake.question: Which step is in the wrong place?

a4_robot_instructions.prompt: Build instructions for the robot 🤖 to reach the treasure 🏁

activity_json.decision_question: IF the password is correct, THEN what happens?

activities.title: 1) Memory or Storage?
activities.prompt: Where does a computer keep things FOREVER, even when it is off?

options.feedback: Memory is fast but forgets when power is off.
Yes! Storage keeps files for a long time.

activities.title: 2) Quick True or False
activities.prompt: Memory is usually faster than storage.
activities.feedback_wrong: Not quite — memory is usually faster.

activities.title: 3) Match the system parts
activities.prompt: Match each item to what it is MOST like.

activities.title: 4) Put the process in order
activities.prompt: How do you make tea? Put the steps in the right order.

activities.title: 5) System Failure!
activities.prompt: Which one is a system failure?

questions.text: A kids app asks for your home address and shares it with others.
An app blocks rude comments and keeps kids safe.

I love building tables and tracking XP data.
I want to connect computers like Lagos to London!
I want to run apps on big servers online.
I want to stop hackers and protect accounts.

options.t: Test + protect kids first, then launch
